title: Business & Finance
text:
Apple announced changes to its App Store regulations that will allow software developers to tell customers about other ways to pay for services outside Apple's ecosystem, part of a proposed settlement of a class-action lawsuit.

---

BofA unveiled its most significant executive shake-up in years, saying that operating chief Tom Montag and Anne Finucane , a vice chairman, will retire.

---

The hacker who is taking responsibility for breaking into T-Mobile 's systems said the wireless company's lax security eased his path into a cache of records.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes posted declines, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both retreating 0.6% and the Dow industrials losing 0.5%.

---

ABC News' president told staffers that she has requested an independent inquiry into how the network handled sexual-assault allegations against a former executive producer of "GMA."

---

Lordstown Motors named Daniel Ninivaggi, a veteran auto-industry executive and onetime lieutenant to Carl Icahn, as its new CEO.

---

Axel Springer agreed to buy Washington, D.C., publisher Politico, expanding the German publisher's portfolio of U.S.-based media holdings.
